message.content:
We start by calculating each ratio using the provided data.

1. Debt to Asset Ratio  
   This ratio is defined as the total liabilities divided by the total assets. In the balance sheet, the only liabilities shown are current liabilities.  
   • Total Liabilities (Current Liabilities – End Amount) = 2,110,671.05  
   • Total Assets (End Amount) = 16,213,861.65  
   Calculation:  
     Debt to Asset Ratio = 2,110,671.05 / 16,213,861.65 ≈ 0.1302  
   Rounded, this becomes approximately 0.13.

2. Gross Profit Margin  
   This ratio is defined as gross profit divided by total revenue, expressed in percentage.  
   • Gross Profit = 2,638,420.67  
   • Total Revenue = 5,813,420.67  
   Calculation:  
     Gross Profit Margin = (2,638,420.67 / 5,813,420.67) × 100 ≈ 45.36%

3. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
   This ratio is calculated as the net cash flow from operating activities divided by the total current liabilities.  
   • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = 1,598,438.00  
   • Total Current Liabilities = 2,110,671.05  
   Calculation:  
     Operating Cash Flow Ratio = 1,598,438.00 / 2,110,671.05 ≈ 0.757  
   Rounded, this is approximately 0.76.

The final answer in the required format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.13",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "45.36%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "0.76"
  }
}
